1    | /*******************************************************************
2    | $Header: ringbuf.h 1.0 Sun 07-23-2000 10:36:48 pm $
3    | 
4    | This is the header file for ringbuf.c which contains functions
5    | for a circular buffer, for character storage and retrieval.
6    | ********************************************************************/
7    | 
8    | #ifndef _RINGBUF_H_	   /*+ Avoid multiple inclusion +*/
9    | #define _RINGBUF_H_
10   | 
11   | #include <stdio.h>
12   | #include <stdlib.h>
13   | 
14   | /*+ Define a BYTE if this is not already done +*/
15   | #ifndef BYTE
16   | #define BYTE unsigned char
17   | #endif
18   | 
19   | /*+ Set an absolute maximum buffer size +*/
20   | #define MAX_RINGBUF_SIZE 4096
21   | 
22   | /*+ This is the structure definition of RINGBUF +*/
23   | typedef struct _RINGBUF_
24   | {
25   |   BYTE *buf;   /*+ Pointer to the created buffer +*/
26   |   int spos;    /*+ Store position +*/
27   |   int rpos;	   /*+ Retrieval position +*/
28   |   int size;	   /*+ Defined ringbuffer size +*/
29   |   size_t cnt;	   /*+ Number of bytes actually stored +*/
30   | } RINGBUF;
31   | 
32   | /*+ Create a ringbuffer with the requested size +*/
33   | RINGBUF *ringbuf_create(int size);
34   | 
35   | /*+ Store a byte in the ringbuffer +*/
36   | void ringbuf_put(RINGBUF *b, BYTE c);
37   | 
38   | /*+ Get a byte from the ringbuffer +*/
39   | int ringbuf_get(RINGBUF *b, BYTE *c);
40   | 
41   | /*+ Peek ahead and Get a byte from the ringbuffer +*/
42   | int ringbuf_peek(RINGBUF *b, BYTE *c);
43   | 
44   | /*+ Delete the ringbuffer from memory +*/
45   | void ringbuf_delete(RINGBUF *buf);
46   | 
47   | /*+ Return the number of available bytes in the ringbuffer +*/
48   | size_t ringbuf_cnt(RINGBUF *b);
49   | 
50   | #endif
51   | 
52   |
